title: Arachidonic acid
summary: Arachidonic acid (AA, sometimes ARA) is a polyunsaturated omega-6 fatty acid 20:4(ω-6), or 20:4(5,8,11,14).[2]  It is structurally related to the saturated arachidic acid found in cupuaçu butter.[3]  Its name derives from the New Latin word arachis (peanut), but it is important to note that peanut oil does not contain any arachidonic acid.[4]
